page.title: 03Life Styles
page.content: {Changing Times. Several people in Cogan have lived here all their lives. Four old people we spoke to came to this school before the First World War. Miss Coles was born in 1887. She lived in the same house all her life. Her father came from Somerset looking for work. He grew vegetables in an allotment and kept pigs and chickens in the back yard. "The pictures on our walls were the salted joints hanging along the passage," she said. Their joints of meat were cooked in the bakehouse in Harriet Street. Houses were let in apartments with two families and lodgers in each terraced house. She remembered the seige of Mafeking, the first time our school bell was rung, and when the housing estate called the Cowslip were fields of cows and horses
